column5: My son is home this weekend for a visit so it was off to the lake and found the fish in familiar old haunts.  Windblown rocky points ---classic looking smallie territory.  To top off the old school pattern they were hitting tubes --low tech but always a good weapon at times  Bushart
Nice tubing there bud. What kind of boat is that?
Good stuff! I'd hardly say dragging tubes for smallies is a dated tactic though!
I second that comment    I grew up with " Sports Afield " reading bass articles by Jason Lucas and tying bass flies originated by Dr Henshall.
Some great looking smallies there Bushart Always great to share some hot spots with family!!! Thanks for sharing Leechman
Smokercraft Pro-Tiller with a 50 4 stroke Merc
